images.copyright: Panther chameleon in Amber Mountain National Park, Madagascar (© Christian Ziegler/Minden Pictures)
images.title: Hide-and-go-seek world champion
images.caption: World Lizard Day
images.desc: Do you hold a warm spot in your heart for these cold-blooded creatures? Lizard lovers celebrate the scaly squamates on this day each year. This camouflaged panther chameleon is one of a multitude of lizards that inhabit the island of Madagascar, many of which are found nowhere else. More than 50% of chameleon species are found only on the island, including the world's smallest known chameleon, the recently discovered Brookesia nana, which is smaller than your fingernail.
